meanings.definition: To command or urge solemnly or earnestly
meanings.sent1: She adjures her students to always strive for their best.
meanings.sent2: The judge adjures the witness to tell the truth.
meanings.sent3: He adjures his cat to stop knocking things off the table.
meanings.sent4: The captain adjures his crew to weather the storm bravely.
meanings.sent5: The coach adjures the team to give their all in the final game.

meanings.definition: To appeal to or entreat earnestly
meanings.sent1: The child adjures his parents to let him stay up late.
meanings.sent2: She adjures her friend to reconsider the decision.
meanings.sent3: He adjures the vending machine to give him a free snack.
meanings.sent4: The beggar adjures passersby for some spare change.
meanings.sent5: The student adjures the teacher for extra credit opportunities.
